name: srg0cl
params: class c0, class c1, class c2

stmt.origin: syl(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c1, c2), wcel(c0, cmnd))
stmt.pretty: syl(c0 ∈ SRing, c1 ∈ c2, c0 ∈ Mnd)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, c2))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ SRing → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ SRing → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Mnd → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c0, cmnd))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ SRing → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ SRing → c0 ∈ Mnd)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Mnd → c1 ∈ c2)

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wi(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, c2))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ SRing → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ (c0 ∈ Mnd → c1 ∈ c2)

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, cmnd), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, csrg), wcel(c1, c2))
-| wceq(c2, cfv(cbs, c0))
-| wceq(c1, cfv(c0g, c0))
cumulated.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ SRing → c1 ∈ c2)
⊣ c2 =(Base ` c0)
⊣ c1 =(0 ` c0)

comment: The zero element of a semiring belongs to its base set. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 12-Jan-2014.) (Revised by Thierry Arnoux, 1-Apr-2018.)
